Hello,
I once did this integration for an image compression project. I don't have
the source code now, but Matlab provides libraries that you include in your
C++ project. You instantiate the Matlab engine, and then send commands to it
, the same way as you write on the matlab console. Matlab help files were
enough to learn how to do this. 

Regards,
Umer Iqbal


-----Original Message-----
From: neat@yahoogroups.com [mailto:neat@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Christopher
Sent: Monday, June 20, 2005 9:09 PM
To: neat@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [neat] NEAT & Simulink

Hi, new user here, and I was wondering if anyone has experience
interfacing the training of a network generated directly from a
Simulink model in matlab? (the NN will be the function approximator
for a reinforcement learning algorithm, so the "updates" to the value
function will come incrementally over time, the full training set is
not available initially), Anyway, I'm just getting started, so any
ideas would be helpful. 

Thanks,

-Chris
